sub_title: Director of Transformation and Communication at The Social Hub
summary:
Strategy is my thing.
The actionable kind. 
Using the power of story, communications, and getting things done. 
To help organisations and brands kick-start a change or accelerate a move forward.

18+ years of B2B/B2C experience in brand, marketing and communications at strategy, creative, and management level | Worked at diversity of globally oriented organisations including co-founding and managing internationally operating event marketing agency

Skills: Brand development, cross-media marketing (from traditional to digital), corporate and marketing communications, CSR/Responsible Business, culture & identity, organisational change and transformation support, team and project management, troubleshooting in complex projects and environments.

Languages: Dutch - native, English - near native, Spanish and German - fluent, and French - ok.

profile_positions.title: Interim Strategist and Manager Brand, Marketing and Communications
Head of Internal Branding and Communications

profile_positions.description:
Key achievements:
* Design Bugaboo Responsible Business mission and strategy as well as kick-start company-wide programme to infuse mission into Bugaboo brand, future product roadmap and internal culture & identity
* Design product and brand proposition for introduction of Bugaboo’s 2nd mobility platform - the Bugaboo Boxer - as well as creation and implementation of cross-media marketing strategy aimed at raising Bugaboo’s global awareness in a new market/with a new audience whilst generating online sales
* Develop Bugaboo long-term brand promise and strategy including Bugaboo’s global brand book

In this role I was responsible for strategic and creative leadership in brand and marketing communications, corporate communications, and corporate social responsibility. 

During my years at Bugaboo I became a driving force in the development of Bugaboo’s long-term brand strategy and the subsequent creation of the brand book and brand story. This was translated in day-to-day content creation, creative storytelling and global activation. 

This included being part of the Bugaboo Boxer introduction team. Here my focus was on creating the brand proposition for one Bugaboo with two product divisions, as well as the new product itself, and the accompanying cross-media marketing strategy aimed at generating online sales. 

As Lead of the cross-functional Bugaboo Responsible Business Team, I worked closely together with Bugaboo’s board and owners to create the strategy and programme to move Bugaboo - the business, its employees, its innovation roadmap, and its brand and communication strategy - towards being a Responsible Business. This holistic programme was developed to integrate Responsible Business thinking and action throughout the organisation.

Responsibility on Corporate Communications included the management of day-to-day issue communications, business profiling, internal communications, and employer communications.
profile_positions.title: Director of Global Communications and Lead Responsible Business

profile_positions.description:
Key achievements:
* Set up global PR agency network to fit the Bugaboo brand and its products. This included selecting and bringing together 14 (independent) lifestyle agencies worldwide.
* Increased creativity and effectiveness of Bugaboo’s PR activities. This included design and implementation of a digital PR/Communications management tool as well as yearly global PR workshops to stimulate collaboration and best practice sharing among all agencies.
* Successful communications and reputation management of two global product recalls

As Global PR Manager I created relevant and strategic PR opportunities that helped build Bugaboo's worldwide brand awareness. My main focus was to re-organise, build and manage an agency network of 14 agencies worldwide that enhanced Bugaboo's expanding international brand and communication efforts, making sure new launches were supported with creative and effective campaigns that worked across different media and at both global and local level. In 2014 I was promoted to Director of Global Communications (see above).
profile_positions.title: Global PR Manager

company.name: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines, Amstelveen, Netherlands

profile_positions.company: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines, Amstelveen, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Key achievements:
* PR introduction of KLM’s new brand positioning and revitalisation of its customer experience
* Implementation web-based communications portal

As independent consultant I advised on and managed several projects that helped reconnect the global sales offices to KLM’s brand experience after the merger with Air France. One of the projects included a web-based international communications portal through which KLM could disseminate and share messages, programmes and ‘best practice’ consistently and instantly. The first programme to be introduced via this portal was KLM’s CO2 compensation service CO2ZERO. Furthermore I led the PR introduction of KLM’s new brand positioning and revitalisation of its customer experience, co-operating with and aligning a diversity of (international) departments company-wide, and their respective agencies.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Communications Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Key achievements:
* Successfully setting up, growing and managing own agency
* Leading large-scale international marketing events from strategy, concept development through to design, communications planning, execution and on-site direction

Co-founding and managing my own agency was like a hands-on MBA. During my three and a half years, the agency grew to a €1 million+ turnover. Its business was to develop large-scale international event marketing projects from strategy and concept development through to design and communications planning, leading up to execution and on-site direction. MC2’s core team included five staff members, but because of the size, intensity, and multi-disciplinary character of the projects, the team was regularly extended with freelancers and subcontractors. Projects managed for Canon Europe in eg. Frankfurt, Stockholm, Milan, London, Budapest, Barcelona, Istanbul, Moscow and Cairo. 

Driven by a shift in personal ambition, I transferred interest and responsibilities to the agency B&S in Amstelveen/Netherlands at the beginning of 2007.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and Managing Director

profile_positions.description: Main responsibility included the development and implementaton of a European marcomms plan for GMAC’s car leasing services under the brand ‘Masterlease’. In addition, whilst based in Madrid for one year, I developed and managed the initial implementation of a local marketing plan for Spain and Portugal. The focus here was on market research and the start-up of sales promotion activities such as telemarketing and sales team training. After this I was requested to develop and implement a marcomms plan for the introduction of a B2B leasing product for SME’s in Germany (based with Adam Opel AG). Focus here was to assist dealerships in making a shift towards a proactive sales strategy.
profile_positions.title: Marketing and Communications Manager Europe

profile_positions.description: Content-driven management and execution of a wide scope of marcoms projects: Introduction video KLM Operations Centre, Promotional video High Speed Train East Netherlands, Retail campaign KPN, launch campaign Mitsubishi Pajero and Unisys’ participation to the Microsoft Tech-Ed conference.
profile_positions.title: Communications Advisor (freelance)

profile_positions.description: Responsible for concept development, production management and budgeting of international private business events and exhibition participations.
profile_positions.title: Account Manager Events
